abstract: As Simon Johnson and James Kwak recount in “13 Bankers: The Wall Street Takeover and the Next Financial Meltdown,” the struggle to keep bankers in check goes back to Thomas Jefferson and Andrew Jackson, with results that have usually been mixed, The New York Times’ Louis Uchitelle writes in a review of the book.
snippet: As Simon Johnson and James Kwak recount in “13 Bankers: The Wall Street Takeover and the Next Financial Meltdown,” the struggle to keep bankers in check goes back to Thomas Jefferson and Andrew Jackson, with results that have usually been mixed, T...
lead_paragraph: Seldom in our 230-odd years as a country have Congress and the White House had the fortitude to impose on American bankers and financiers a set of regulations sufficiently stringent to prevent them from pushing us into destructive panics and recessions. And once again Washington may be demonstrating its lack of backbone, The New York Times’s Louis Uchitelle writes.

abstract: Bank of America has narrowed the contenders for chairman to directors Frank Bramble and Charles Holliday, according to The Wall Street Journal.
snippet: Bank of America has narrowed the contenders for chairman to directors Frank Bramble and Charles Holliday, according to The Wall Street Journal.
lead_paragraph: Bank of America has narrowed the contenders for chairman to the directors Frank Bramble and Charles Holliday, according to The Wall Street Journal.

headline.main: BofA Said to Near Decision on Chairman
